cx.corp.lacuna.core

Interface MemoryReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemoryReaderImpl

    public interface MemoryReader
    Provides methods for reading bytes from the memory of a native process and constructing common Java types from them.
    See Also:
    NativeProcessEnumerator, RawMemoryReader

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] read(NativeProcess process, int offset, int bytesToRead)
      Reads a region of memory from the specified offset.
      boolean readBoolean(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads a byte from the specified offset and interprets it as a boolean value.
      byte readByte(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads a byte from the specified offset.
      char readCharUTF16LE(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads two bytes from the specified offset and decodes the data using little-endian UTF-16.
      char readCharUTF8(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads a byte from the specified offset and decodes the data using UTF-8.
      double readDouble(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads eight bytes from the specified offset and constructs a double precision IEEE 754 floating point value from the data.
      float readFloat(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads four bytes from the specified offset and constructs a single precision IEEE 754 floating point value from the data.
      int readInt(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads four bytes from the specified offset and constructs an integer from the data.
      long readLong(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads eight bytes from the specified offset and constructs a long integer from the data.
      short readShort(NativeProcess process, int offset)
      Reads two bytes from the specified offset and constructs a short integer from the data.
      java.lang.String readStringUTF16LE(NativeProcess process, int offset, int maxCodeUnitsToRead)
      Reads two-byte UTF-16 little-endian code units from the specified offset until either a null character or the specified limit is met, then constructs a String from the data.
      java.lang.String readStringUTF8(NativeProcess process, int offset, int maxCodeUnitsToRead)
      Reads 8-bit UTF-8 code units from the specified offset until either a null character or the specified limit is met, then constructs a String from the data.

    • Method Detail

      • readBoolean

        boolean readBoolean(NativeProcess process,
                    int offset)
             throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads a byte from the specified offset and interprets it as a boolean value. Any nonzero value will be interpreted as true, whereas zero will be interpreted as false.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        True if the read byte is nonzero, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.

      • readByte

        byte readByte(NativeProcess process,
              int offset)
       throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads a byte from the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The read value.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.

      • readCharUTF8

        char readCharUTF8(NativeProcess process,
                  int offset)
           throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads a byte from the specified offset and decodes the data using UTF-8.

        Notice that this method only cannot read multi-byte UTF-8 code points. To read more than one byte at a time, see readStringUTF8(NativeProcess, int, int).

        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The decoded byte.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        See Also:
        readCharUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int), readStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, int), readStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, int)

      • readCharUTF16LE

        char readCharUTF16LE(NativeProcess process,
                     int offset)
              throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads two bytes from the specified offset and decodes the data using little-endian UTF-16.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The decoded value.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        See Also:
        readCharUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int), readStringUTF16LE(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, int), readStringUTF8(cx.corp.lacuna.core.domain.NativeProcess, int, int)

      • readShort

        short readShort(NativeProcess process,
                int offset)
         throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads two bytes from the specified offset and constructs a short integer from the data.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The read value.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

      • readInt

        int readInt(NativeProcess process,
            int offset)
     throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads four bytes from the specified offset and constructs an integer from the data.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The read value.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

      • readFloat

        float readFloat(NativeProcess process,
                int offset)
         throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads four bytes from the specified offset and constructs a single precision IEEE 754 floating point value from the data.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The read value.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The read value.
        Throws:

        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

      • readDouble

        double readDouble(NativeProcess process,
                  int offset)
           throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads eight bytes from the specified offset and constructs a double precision IEEE 754 floating point value from the data.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        Returns:
        The read value.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        This method uses little-endian byte order to represent multi-byte values.

      • readStringUTF8

        java.lang.String readStringUTF8(NativeProcess process,
                                int offset,
                                int maxCodeUnitsToRead)
                         throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads 8-bit UTF-8 code units from the specified offset until either a null character or the specified limit is met, then constructs a String from the data.

        Notice that UTF-8 is a variable length character encoding, in which Unicode code points higher than U+007F are encoded with two to four 8-bit code units. This method does not synchronize reads to read a full code point, so reads ending at the middle of a code point are possible.

        This method stops reading when the 8-bit pattern 0x00 is met, or when maxCodeUnitsToRead has been reached.

        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        maxCodeUnitsToRead - The maximum amount of 8-bit code units to read.
        Returns:
        A non-null String consisting of the read characters.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if attempting to read less than one code unit.

      • readStringUTF16LE

        java.lang.String readStringUTF16LE(NativeProcess process,
                                   int offset,
                                   int maxCodeUnitsToRead)
                            throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads two-byte UTF-16 little-endian code units from the specified offset until either a null character or the specified limit is met, then constructs a String from the data.

        Notice that UTF-16 is a variable length character encoding, in which Unicode code points higher than U+10000 are encoded as two 16-bit surrogate pairs. This method does not synchronize reads to read a full code point, so reads ending before the trailing surrogate pair are possible.

        This method stops reading when the 16-bit pattern 0x0000 is met, or when maxCodeUnitsToRead has been reached.

        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        maxCodeUnitsToRead - The maximum amount of 16-bit code units to read.
        Returns:
        A non-null String consisting of the read characters.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if attempting to read less than one code unit.

      • read

        byte[] read(NativeProcess process,
            int offset,
            int bytesToRead)
     throws MemoryAccessException
        Reads a region of memory from the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        process - The native process whose memory to read.
        offset - The memory address offset to read from.
        bytesToRead - The amount of bytes to read, starting from the offset.
        Returns:
        The read bytes.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if reading fails due to, for example, an access violation or insufficient rights, or if the read request is only partially completed.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if process is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if attempting to read less than one byte.
